intro: Cissampelos laurifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf moonvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often consumed by birds and mammals. Its roots and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. Cissampelos laurifolia thrives in humid environments and is often found in forests or along riverbanks.
